text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Atomiswave is a cartridge system for a JAMMA arcade machine, created by the Japanese company Sammy in 2003. It is a low-cost and modular system, with the possibility of easily connecting a pistol, a steering wheel or a trackball. It is equipped with a 200 MHz processor, 32 MB of RAM and PowerVR 2. From its launch, it has the support of the company SNK Playmore which decided to use this system for its future games, just like Dimps, IGS and Arc System Works, but the majority of Atomiswave titles are developed by Sammy who merged with Sega in 2004.
